intro: Eremostachys tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan eremostachys, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and upright growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species suited to rocky and sandy soils. Eremostachys tianschanica is often found in alpine and steppe habitats, where it thrives in full sun and low moisture conditions.
